EnvironmentÔÉÅ

The environment class manages the Reinforcement Leaning environment. It inherits from OpenAIs gym class which defines several core functions for an environment.

class model.environment.KGEnv(data_manager: DataManager, dataset: str, single_relation_pair: tuple, embedding: str, is_distance: bool, seed: int, threads: int, path_length: int, regenerate_embeddings: bool, normalize_embeddings: bool, gpu_accel: bool, use_episodes: bool, laps: int, verbose: bool)ÔÉÅ

Defines the environment and keeps track of the episodes that have been elapsed during training. We use the Gym package (https://github.com/openai/gym) as it offers a standard model to generate environments and tie them up with keras agents.

### Description The environment is the currently selected knowledge graph built with inverse relationships

The agent is positioned in the initial node that we want to connect via a certain relationship and then we act over the graph moving the agents location trying to find the end entity for the triple.

### Action space The actions vary depending on the current node we are in, we can take any edge connected to this node as an action moving the agent to the next node, actions are pairs of (‚Äúrelation‚Äù,‚Äùnode‚Äù)

### Observation space Since the complete state of the graph cannot be observed by the agent due to the size limitations we make the agent aware of its current location (et) and the query triple(e1q, rq, e?), but not the answer (e2q)

Parameters

  • data_manager ‚Äì The data manager instance asociated

  • dataset ‚Äì The name of the folder containing the dataset file (graph.txt)

  • single_relation_pair ‚Äì (is_single_rel(bool), single_rel_name(str)), the tuple representing if we are training for a single relation.

  • embedding ‚Äì the embedding representation to load.

  • is_distance ‚Äì if the reward calculation contains distance.

  • seed ‚Äì the seed to operate on

  • threads ‚Äì number of cores to use on calculations.

  • path_length ‚Äì the length of path exploration.

  • regenerate_embeddings ‚Äì wether to regenerate embeddings or use the saved ones.

  • normalize_embeddings ‚Äì if recalculation is active, wether to normalize them.

  • gpu_accel ‚Äì wether to use the gpu for calculations.

  • use_episodes ‚Äì wether to use a set number of episodes or not

  • laps ‚Äì the loops to perform over the dataset.

  • verbose ‚Äì wether to print detailed information every episode.

It‚Äôs functions can be divided into 4 sections

GymÔÉÅ

OpenAIs gym provides several functions, we override several of them to fit our environment, these are:

model.environment.KGEnv.step(self, action: list)ÔÉÅ

Performs one environment step, determined by the recieved action.

Parameters

action ‚Äì the action in its triple format

Returns

state -> the current state after the step is performed.

done -> if the episode is done.

info -> empty dict (conforming with gym, but we provide no extra info.)

model.environment.KGEnv.reset(self)ÔÉÅ

resets the environment for the next episode.

Returns

the state after the reset.

model.environment.KGEnv.action_space()ÔÉÅ

Returns the action space of the environment, which is the minimum and maximum values of the embeddings. These do not all represent possible actions, but the scope in which actions can be contained.

Returns

A boxed state (gym.spaces) of all possible actions in the current environment.

model.environment.KGEnv.observation_space()ÔÉÅ

Returns the observation space of the environment, which is the minimum and maximum values of the embeddings. These do not all represent possible observation, but the scope in which observations can be contained.

Returns

A boxed space(gym.spaces) of all possible observations in the current environment.

CachesÔÉÅ

We build a reward cache to avoid calculating the same reward twice since it is a costly task. These functions handle the initialization and storage of these caches.

model.environment.KGEnv.cache_init(self, dataset: str, is_distance: bool)ÔÉÅ

initializes the cache for distance rewards for the selected dataset.

Parameters

  • dataset ‚Äì the name of the dataset

  • is_distance ‚Äì if true tries to load cache, sets cache to None otherwise.

model.environment.KGEnv.save_current_cache(self, dataset: str)ÔÉÅ

saves the dataset cache.

Parameters

dataset ‚Äì the dataset name

States, Observations & ActionsÔÉÅ

These functions manage the observations and actions that are currently available in the environment. They calculate where the agent can and cannot go, how probable an action is and which triples are left to explore.

model.environment.KGEnv.get_current_state(self)ÔÉÅ

returns the current state of the environment.

Returns

self.target_triple[0] -> e1

self.target_triple[1] -> r

self.target_triple[2] -> e2

self.current_node -> et

model.environment.KGEnv.get_encoded_state(self)ÔÉÅ

The encoding of the state is just the addition of the embedding representation of the triple + the node position.

Returns

[*e1,*r,*e2,*et]

model.environment.KGEnv.get_encoded_observations(self)ÔÉÅ

The encoding of the observations is just the addition of the embedding representation of the query + the node position.

Returns

[(*e1,*r),*et]

model.environment.KGEnv.select_target(self)ÔÉÅ

choose a new target triple to find.

Returns

true if valid triple is found, false otherwise.

model.environment.KGEnv.reset_queries(self)ÔÉÅ

resets the queries and randomizes them

model.environment.KGEnv.update_actions(self)ÔÉÅ

Updates the actions for the new step

Rewards & EmbeddingsÔÉÅ

These functions manage the embeddings and rewards calculated for each step.

model.environment.KGEnv.get_distance(self, current_node: str, end_node: str)ÔÉÅ

given the current node calculate the minimum distance to the end node.

Parameters

  • current_node ‚Äì the current node in the environment

  • end_node ‚Äì the target node.

Returns

the distance to the end node from the current node.

model.environment.KGEnv.dist_func(self, init_index: int, last_index: int, to_evaluate: list, d: int, done_flag: bool, to_evaluate_next_step: list, visited: list, current_node: str, end_node: str)ÔÉÅ

helper function to calculate the distance to the end node.

Parameters

  • init_index ‚Äì starting point in list of nodes to evaluate.

  • last_index ‚Äì end point in list of nodes to evaluate

  • to_evaluate ‚Äì the current list of nodes to get the neighbors to.

  • d ‚Äì current distance from starting node.

  • done_flag ‚Äì true if we reached the last node.

  • to_evaluate_next_step ‚Äì the next iteration list of nodes to evaluate.

  • visited ‚Äì the list of visited nodes.

  • current_node ‚Äì the current node of exploration

  • end_node ‚Äì the destination node.

model.environment.KGEnv.calculate_embedding_min_max(self)ÔÉÅ

Iterates over the embedding representations of the entities and relations and computes the minimum and maximum values to be used in a gym.Spaces.Box()

Returns

mins_rel, mins_ent, maxs_rel, maxs_ent (the minimum and maximum values for entities and relations.)

model.environment.KGEnv.get_embedding_info(self, evaluated_node: str, end_node: str)ÔÉÅ

Calculate the embedding rewards for the current node.

Parameters

  • evaluated_node ‚Äì the current node of exploration.

  • end_node ‚Äì the destination node.

Returns

this is a description of what is returned

Pair dictionaryÔÉÅ

The caches use a special implementation of the dict class that can only ever accept tuples as keys.

class model.environment.pairdict(*args)ÔÉÅ

Extends the basic python dict to only accept pairs as keys

These are the overriden function sigantures

model.environment.pairdict.__getitem__(self, key)ÔÉÅ

x.__getitem__(y) <==> x[y]

model.environment.pairdict.__setitem__(self, key, val)ÔÉÅ

Set self[key] to value.

and the auxiliary function

model.environment.pairdict.tuple_check(self, key)ÔÉÅ
